Zelensky, amid political turmoil, remains cautious about US-Russia peace plan
subhead: The Ukrainian president said he was reviewing the leaked 28-point draft peace proposal revealed by the press. At the same time, he is grappling with several corruption scandals that are undermining his government.

How Macron enlisted regional papers in his fight against social media's 'fake news'
subhead: To organize his 'Tour of France' on the dangers of the digital world, the president called on the regional daily press to organize debates with the French public.

title: International aid to fight AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria is declining: 'Countries will have to accelerate pathway to self-reliance'
subhead: Peter Sands, the director of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, discusses the stakes of the donor countries' summit set to open in Johannesburg on Friday.

title: Azzedine Alaïa's Dior collection on view in Paris
subhead: The Galerie Dior is showcasing around one hundred pieces from the personal collection of French-Tunisian designer Azzedine Alaïa, a renowned fashion collector. This rare and captivating exhibition is richly documented and unprecedented in scope.

title: Aya Nakamura's 'Destinée': Singer's fifth album brims with renewed energy
subhead: The singer steps out of her comfort zone, experimenting with Caribbean shatta and sultry R&B while staying true to her zouk roots.

Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US: 'You are effectively blacklisted by much of the world's banking system'
subhead: Six judges and three prosecutors at the International Criminal Court have been sanctioned by the Trump administration. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou discusses the impact of these measures on his work and daily life.

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

title: Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.
